name: Sudima Hotel Christchurch Airport

reviews.text: Once a year this hotel becomes a home away from home for my coworkers and I. I've stayed in this hotel over 20 times. In every wing and type of room and there are a few things I know to be true.
reviews.title: Not here by choice

likes.liked: — Por quality rooms, no air conditioning and windows that don't open.

reviews.title: Excellent Reception//Front Office
reviews.text: 1. Each year the menu prices rise dramatically.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The lack of Air Conditioning can make this hotel swelter.
reviews.title: Need upgrading
Great for the airport
reviews.text: 3. The hotel bar is a saving grace and not open nearly enough.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4. The new wing has the only rooms worth staying in. The cement walls have eliminated the noise from adjoining rooms. Sad to say, I will no longer be woken up by Japanese orgies in the next room. True story.
reviews.title: A bed, a room but not exciting
What a Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel has a free shuttle service running to and from the airport. We arrived on a late flight and there were quite a few others to check in at the same time. The front desk staff were quick and fun to talk too. We ended up getting a free upgrade.

The hotel was very handy and it was value for money. They have recently refurnished the hotel and the room we stayed in was immaculate. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anybody passing through Christchurch.
reviews.title: Not so good
Not a 3 star!!!!
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night before we flew home to the UK mainly because of its location. The hotel is small and very dated. We were upgraded to a suite on arrival but you would not have known. The room had no air-conditioning and looked old, even though it was suppose have been refurbished recently.

reviews.title: Convenient and clean
reviews.text: Clean, pretty modern and overall very comfortable. I wouldn't necessarily want to stay longer than 1 night - but it's an ideal airport hotel as it's pretty reasonable and very close to the terminals.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night as a final destination before hopping on a plane. The place was old and dated, the carpets were not very clean, and we felt very eerie when we found that the emergency/fire switches had been pulled from the wall...
reviews.title: Good for a night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our free transport took forever, as there was no driver ready for us when we waited, even though we had told them the day before of our travel times.
reviews.title: Couldnt get closer to the airport

likes.liked: — Only literally a step away from the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were nice and simple, though the beds weren't very nice.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: This is the perfect stopover hotel, but I would recommend something more if you were to stay longer.
reviews.title: good for one night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel could not be more convenient - you dont even need the to use the hotel shuttle its so close to international arrivals (but you might as well cos its free). Excellent base for picking up a campervan at the nearby Britz/Maui place. Only dissapointment being hotel was very tired - felt much like a faceless "Travelodge". It did appear to be undergoing some renovation though which will undoutbedly improve it. (The reno work did not disturb us by the way). However, it was clean and the service was good both on reception and at breakfast.
reviews.title: very convient but tired hotel

likes.liked: — recommended as a stop over hotel only for its excellent location
